New Records: Shohei Ohtani recorded his 56th stolen base of the season
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a 448-foot shot, tying the game at 3-3 with two outs in the fifth
Shohei Ohtani singled in the go-ahead run before stealing his 56th base of the season
Donovan Solano struck out swinging on a 101-mph fastball to end the game
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Mike Shildt said the Padres are playing for the division title, but it's out of their hands as far as destiny goes
The Padres have to win Thursday to have any hope of taking the National League West title
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Mike Shildt mentioned that the Padres still have a shot at the division title
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers increased their lead over the second-place Padres to three games with four to play
The Dodgers reduced their magic number to two
The game was played at a sellout crowd of 52,310 at Dodger Stadium
Others: The Padres' five-game winning streak ended
The Dodgers struck early and took a 1-0 lead in the first
The Padres quickly took a 2-1 lead in the second
The Dodgers scored the tying and go-ahead runs with two outs in the fourth
